intro: Plesioneuron wariense, commonly known as the Wariense fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, intricate fronds that are typically small and closely arranged. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Plesioneuron wariense plays a role in maintaining the biodiversity of its native ecosystems by providing habitat and resources for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
